      <p>There are eight terrestrial television channels in Malta: <a href="/wiki/TVM_(Malta)" class="mw-redirect" title="TVM (Malta)">TVM</a>, <a href="/wiki/TVM2" title="TVM2">TVM2</a>, <a href="/wiki/Parliament_TV_(Malta)" title="Parliament TV (Malta)">Parliament TV</a>, <a href="/wiki/One_(Maltese_TV_channel)" title="One (Maltese TV channel)">One</a>, <a href="/wiki/NET_Television_(Malta)" class="mw-redirect" title="NET Television (Malta)">NET Television</a>, <a href="/wiki/Smash_Television" title="Smash Television">Smash Television</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=F_Living&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="F Living (page does not exist)">F Living</a> and <a href="/wiki/Xejk" title="Xejk">Xejk</a>. These channels are transmitted by digital terrestrial, free-to-air signals on <a href="/wiki/Ultra_high_frequency" title="Ultra high frequency">UHF</a> channel 66.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">[303]</a></sup> The state and <a href="/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Malta" title="List of political parties in Malta">political parties</a> subsidise most of the funding of these television stations. TVM, TVM2, and Parliament TV are operated by <a href="/wiki/Public_Broadcasting_Services" title="Public Broadcasting Services">Public Broadcasting Services</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Public_broadcasting" title="Public broadcasting">national broadcaster</a>, and members of the <a href="/wiki/European_Broadcasting_Union" title="European Broadcasting Union">EBU</a>. Media.link Communications Ltd., the owner of NET Television, and <a href="/wiki/One_Productions_Ltd" class="mw-redirect" title="One Productions Ltd">One Productions Ltd</a>., the owner of One, are affiliated with the <a href="/wiki/Nationalist_Party_(Malta)" title="Nationalist Party (Malta)">Nationalist</a> and <a href="/wiki/Labour_Party_(Malta)" title="Labour Party (Malta)">Labour</a> parties, respectively. The rest are privately owned. The Malta Broadcasting Authority supervises all local broadcasting stations and ensures their compliance with legal and licence obligations as well as the preservation of due impartiality; in respect of matters of political or industrial controversy or relating to current public policy; while fairly apportioning broadcasting facilities and time between persons belong to different political parties. The Broadcasting Authority ensures that local broadcasting services consist of public, private and community broadcasts that offer varied and comprehensive programming to cater for all interests and tastes.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (August 2015)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup> </p>
      <p>The Malta Communications Authority reported that there were 147,896 pay TV subscriptions active at the end of 2012, which includes analogue and digital cable, pay digital terrestrial TV and IPTV.<sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">[304]</a></sup> For reference the latest census counts 139,583 households in Malta.<sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">[305]</a></sup> Satellite reception is available to receive other European television networks such as the <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">BBC</a> from Great Britain and <a href="/wiki/RAI" title="RAI">RAI</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mediaset" title="Mediaset">Mediaset</a> from Italy.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (August 2015)">citation needed</span></a></i>]</sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Holidays">Holidays</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=44" title="Edit section: Holidays">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">

      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sport">Sport</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=45" title="Edit section: Sport">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Sport_in_Malta" title="Sport in Malta">Sport in Malta</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/66/Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg/220px-Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/66/Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg/330px-Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/66/Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg/440px-Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3264" data-file-height="2448"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Ta%27_Qali_National_Stadium_Main_Tribune.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/National_Stadium,_Ta%27_Qali" title="National Stadium, Ta' Qali">National Stadium, Ta' Qali</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>In 2018 Malta hosted its first <a href="/wiki/Esports" title="Esports">Esports</a> tournament, 'Supernova CS:GO Malta',<sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">[306]</a></sup> a <a href="/wiki/Counter-Strike:_Global_Offensive" title="Counter-Strike: Global Offensive">Counter Strike: Global Offensive</a> tournament with a $150,000 prize pool.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">[307]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=46" title="Edit section: See also">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r936637989">.mw-parser-output .portal{border:solid #aaa 1px;padding:0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tleft{margin:0.5em 1em 0.5em 0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tright{margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul{display:table;box-sizing:border-box;padding:0.1em;max-width:175px;background:#f9f9f9;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li{display:table-row}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:first-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:last-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle}</style>
      <div role="navigation" aria-label="Portals" class="noprint portal plainlist tright"> 
       <ul> 
        <li><span><img alt="flag" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Malta.svg/32px-Flag_of_Malta.svg.png" decoding="async" width="32" height="21" class="noviewer thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Malta.svg/48px-Flag_of_Malta.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/Flag_of_Malta.svg/64px-Flag_of_Malta.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"></span><span><a href="/wiki/Portal:Malta" title="Portal:Malta">Malta portal</a></span></li>
       </ul>
      </div> 
      <ul>
       <li><a href="/wiki/Outline_of_Malta" title="Outline of Malta">Outline of Malta</a></li> 
       <li><a href="/wiki/Index_of_Malta-related_articles" title="Index of Malta-related articles">Index of Malta-related articles</a></li>

      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=47" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

         <li id="cite_note-Frommer-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Frommer_12-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFLesley2009" class="citation book cs1">Lesley, Anne Rose (15 April 2009). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Gr3g2SMGPZgC"><i>Frommer's Malta and Gozo Day by Day</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-constitution-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-constitution_25-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20181001103554/http://justiceservices.gov.mt/DownloadDocument.aspx?app=lom&amp;itemid=8566">"Constitution of Malta"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 February</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Constitution+of+Malta&amp;rft.pub=Ministry+for+Justice%2C+Culture+and+Local+Government&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fjusticeservices.gov.mt%2FDownloadDocument.aspx%3Fapp%3Dlom%26itemid%3D8566&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span> - Article 40: "all persons in Malta shall have full freedom of conscience and enjoy the free exercise of their respective mode of religious worship."</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-cia-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-cia_26-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cia_26-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-cia_26-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCentral_Intelligence_Agency_(CIA)" class="citation web cs1">Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/malta/">"Malta"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 May</span> 2007</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+World+Factbook&amp;rft.atitle=Malta&amp;rft.au=Central+Intelligence+Agency+%28CIA%29&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cia.gov%2Fthe-world-factbook%2Fcountries%2Fmalta%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-27"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-27">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/130">"Hal Saflieni Hypogeum"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-gozo-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-gozo_41-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-gozo_41-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090321192841/http://www.islandofgozo.org/history.htm">"Gozo"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-books.google.co.uk-43"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-books.google.co.uk_43-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDennis_Angelo_Castillo2006" class="citation book cs1">Dennis Angelo Castillo (2006). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=i5ns5LNtoiUC&amp;pg=PA25"><i>The Maltese Cross A Strategic History of Malta</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-44">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFVictor_Paul_Borg2001" class="citation book cs1">Victor Paul Borg (2001). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/roughguidetomalt00borg"><i>Malta and Gozo</i></a></span>. Rough Guides. p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/roughguidetomalt00borg/page/331">331</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-85828-680-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-85828-680-8"><bdi>978-1-85828-680-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Malta+and+Gozo&amp;rft.pages=331&amp;rft.pub=Rough+Guides&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-85828-680-8&amp;rft.au=Victor+Paul+Borg&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Froughguidetomalt00borg&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-ReferenceA-45"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ReferenceA_45-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation book cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20140914/local/So-who-are-the-real-Maltese-.535578"><i>So who are the 'real' Maltese</i></a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160312063245/http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20140914/local/So-who-are-the-real-Maltese-.535578">Archived</a> from the original on 12 March 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 September</span> 2017</span>. <q>There's a gap between 800 and 1200 where there is no record of civilisation. It doesn't mean the place was completely uninhabited. There may have been a few people living here and there, but not muchâ¦â¦..The Arab influence on the Maltese language is not a result of Arab rule in Malta, Prof. Felice said. The influence is probably indirect, since the Arabs raided the island and left no-one behind, except for a few people. There are no records of civilisation of any kind at the time. The kind of Arabic used in the Maltese language is most likely derived from the language spoken by those that repopulated the island from Sicily in the early second millennium; it is known as Siculo-Arab. The Maltese are mostly descendants of these people.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=So+who+are+the+%27real%27+Maltese&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.timesofmalta.com%2Farticles%2Fview%2F20140914%2Flocal%2FSo-who-are-the-real-Maltese-.535578&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-46"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-46">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation book cs1"><i>The origin of the Maltese surnames</i>. <q>Ibn Khaldun puts the expulsion of Islam from the Maltese Islands to the year 1249. It is not clear what actually happened then, except that the Maltese language, derived from Arabic, certainly survived. Either the number of Christians was far larger than Giliberto had indicated, and they themselves already spoke Maltese, or a large proportion of the Muslims themselves accepted baptism and stayed behind. Henri Bresc has written that there are indications of further Muslim political activity in Malta during the last Suabian years. Anyhow there is no doubt that by the beginning of Angevin times no professed Muslim Maltese remained either as free persons or even as serfs on the island.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+origin+of+the+Maltese+surnames&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-1940-43-47"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-1940-43_47-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-1940-43_47-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHolland2003" class="citation book cs1">Holland, James (2003). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/fortressmaltaisl00holl"><i>Fortress Malta An Island Under Siege 1940â43</i></a>. Miramax. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4013-5186-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4013-5186-1"><bdi>978-1-4013-5186-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Fortress+Malta+An+Island+Under+Siege+1940%E2%80%9343&amp;rft.pub=Miramax&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4013-5186-1&amp;rft.aulast=Holland&amp;rft.aufirst=James&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Ffortressmaltaisl00holl&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

Mifsud, C. Savona-Ventura, S. Mifsud</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-63">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160304105117/http://www.edrichton.com/Excursions/Mdinaknights/index.htm">"Mdina &amp; The Knights"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-cassar53â55-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cassar53â55_64-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCassar2000">Cassar 2000</a>, pp.&nbsp;53â55</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-maltihist-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-maltihist_65-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-maltihist_65-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-gozmalt-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-gozmalt_84-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBain2004" class="citation book cs1">Bain, Carolyn (2004). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/lonelyplanetmalt00caro"><i>Malta &amp; Gozo</i></a></span>. Lonely Planet. p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/lonelyplanetmalt00caro/page/22">22</a>. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-74059-178-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-74059-178-2"><bdi>978-1-74059-178-2</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-85">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Charles_William_Previt%C3%A9-Orton" class="mw-redirect" title="Charles William PrevitÃ©-Orton">PrevitÃ©-Orton</a> (1971), pg. 507â11</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-86">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Blouet, B. (1987) The Story of Malta. Third Edition. Malta: Progress Press, p.37.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-87">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Blouet, B. (1987) The Story of Malta. Third Edition. Malta: Progress Press, p.37-38.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Robert_Montgomery_Martin" title="Robert Montgomery Martin">Martin, Robert Montgomery</a> (1843). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=yDQGAAAAMAAJ&amp;pg=RA1-PA568"><i>History of the colonies of the British Empire</i></a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150906192512/https://books.google.com/books?id=yDQGAAAAMAAJ&amp;pg=RA1-PA568">Archived</a> 6 September 2015 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, W. H. Allen, p. 569: "Malta remained for 72 years subject of the emperors of Germany. The island was after the period of Count Roger of the Normans afterward given up to the Germans, on account of the marriage between Constance, heiress of Sicily, and Henry VI, son of the Emperor Friedrick Barbarossa. Malta was elevated to a county and a marquisate, but its trade was now totally ruined, and for a considerable period of it remained solely a fortified garrison."</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-137"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-137">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-171"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-171">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://ec.europa.eu/regional_policy/sources/docoffic/official/reports/coheter/coheter_en.pdf">"Interim Territorial Cohesion Report"</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130423165806/http://ec.europa.eu/regional_policy/sources/docoffic/official/reports/coheter/coheter_en.pdf">Archived</a> 23 April 2013 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a> â Preliminary results of ESPON and EU Commission studies</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-189"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-189">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aboutmalta.com/grazio/study2.html">"Evolution of the Maltese Language"</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070403081145/http://www.aboutmalta.com/grazio/study2.html">Archived</a> from the original on 3 April 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-LinguisticView-242"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-LinguisticView_242-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LinguisticView_242-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LinguisticView_242-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LinguisticView_242-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Ignasi Badia i Capdevila (2004) <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120312145908/http://www6.gencat.cat/llengcat/noves/hm04primavera-estiu/a_badia2_3.htm">A view of the linguistic situation in Malta</a>.          <li id="cite_note-243"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-243">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/country_profiles/1045691.stm">Country profile: Malta</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120607062334/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/country_profiles/1045691.stm">Archived</a> 7 June 2012 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>.       <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Attribution">Attribution</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=50" title="Edit section: Attribution">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3> 
      <ul>
       <li>
        <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20091028215840/http://encarta.msn.com/encyclopedia_761555566/Malta.html">"Malta"</a>. <i>MSN Encarta</i>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://encarta.msn.com/encyclopedia_761555566/Malta.html">the original</a> on 28 October 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 November</span> 2005</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Malta&amp;rft.btitle=MSN+Encarta&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fencarta.msn.com%2Fencyclopedia_761555566%2FMalta.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AMalta" class="Z3988"></span></li>
      </ul>

                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg/23px-Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg/35px-Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg/45px-Flag_of_%C5%BBurrieq.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="180" data-file-height="120"></span> <a href="/wiki/Filfla" title="Filfla">Filfla</a></li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg/23px-Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg/35px-Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/43/Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg/45px-Flag_of_Mellie%C4%A7a.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="188" data-file-height="125"></span> <a href="/wiki/St_Paul%27s_Island" title="St Paul's Island">Saint Paul's Islands</a> (Il-GÅ¼ejjer ta' San Pawl)</li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg/23px-Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg/35px-Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg/45px-Flag_of_G%C5%BCira.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"></span> <a href="/wiki/Manoel_Island" title="Manoel Island">Manoel Island</a> (Il-GÅ¼ira Manoel)</li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Flag_of_Qala.svg/23px-Flag_of_Qala.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Flag_of_Qala.svg/35px-Flag_of_Qala.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Flag_of_Qala.svg/45px-Flag_of_Qala.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"></span> <a href="/wiki/%C4%A6alfa_Rock" title="Ä¦alfa Rock">Ä¦alfa Rock</a> (Il-Ä ebla tal-Ä¦alfa)</li> 
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg/23px-Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg/35px-Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg/45px-Flag_of_San_Lawrenz.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"></span> <a href="/wiki/Fungus_Rock" title="Fungus Rock">Fungus Rock</a> (Il-Ä ebla tal-Ä eneral)</li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="1" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">

                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px;padding:0 0.5em;">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe"><img alt="Europe orthographic Caucasus Urals boundary (with borders).svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/100px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="100" height="100" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/150px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/200px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="537" data-file-height="536"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">
                 <div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">

                 </div></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">

                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>

                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Iceland" title="Iceland">Iceland</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/Iceland%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="IcelandâEuropean Union relations">EU relations</a>)</small></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Liechtenstein" title="Liechtenstein">Liechtenstein</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/Liechtenstein%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="LiechtensteinâEuropean Union relations">EU relations</a>)</small></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Norway" title="Norway">Norway</a> <small>(<a href="/wiki/Norway%E2%80%93European_Union_relations" title="NorwayâEuropean Union relations">EU relations</a>)</small></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="2" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/File:Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg" class="image"><img alt="Agreement on the European Economic Area.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/80px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png" decoding="async" width="80" height="80" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/120px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg/160px-Agreement_on_the_European_Economic_Area.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="610" data-file-height="610"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>

                 <div> 
                  <ol>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of China">Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China</a>, participates as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao China".</li> 
                   <li>Officially the Republic of China, participates as "<a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu</a>", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.</li>
                  </ol>
